lines.content: ChatTPG is a lightweight, keyboard‑only task assistant that helps you track three kinds of tasks:
* Event – description + a start (/from) and end (/to)
All data is auto‑saved to `tasks/tasks.txt` whenever you add, delete, mark, or unmark a task. You can safely exit and your tasks will persist.
1. Run the program – you start at the Main Menu.
2. Type `open task organiser` to manage tasks.
3. Add tasks with the formats below.
4. Use `list`, `mark done`, `mark undone`, `find`, or `delete task` as needed.
5. Type `exit task organiser` (or `bye`) to return to Main Menu.
6. Type `bye` again at the Main Menu to fully exit.
Need help inside the Task Organiser? Type `help`.
| `open task organiser` | Enter the task management interface |
| `bye` | Exit the whole application (from main menu) |
When inside the organiser, `bye` or `exit task organiser` returns you to the main menu instead of quitting immediately.
| `todo <desc>` | Add a todo task | `todo read book` |
| `deadline <desc> /by <when>` | Add a deadline task | `deadline return book /by 2025-10-01` |
| `event <desc> /from <start> /to <end>` | Add an event task | `event project meeting /from 2025-10-03 1400 /to 2025-10-03 1600` |
| `mark done` | Mark a task done (will prompt for number) | `mark done` → enter `2` |
| `mark undone` | Mark a task undone (will prompt for number) | `mark undone` → enter `2` |
| `delete task` | Delete a task (will prompt for number) | `delete task` → enter `3` |
| `find` | Search by a SINGLE keyword (prompts for it) | `find` → enter `book` |
| `exit task organiser` / `bye` | Return to main menu | `bye` |
* The `find` feature only accepts one word (no spaces). If you enter multiple words it will warn you.
* Task numbers are 1‑based (as shown in the `list` output).
* Invalid indices or malformed commands show an error without crashing.
* Second bracket: Status – `[✓]` done, `[ ]` not done.
Tasks are stored in `tasks/tasks.txt` using a pipe‑delimited line format:
* Second: `1` if done, `0` if not done
The file is recreated automatically if missing; no manual setup required.
| Unknown command | Shows an error + how to view help |
| Invalid task number | Explains valid range |
| Malformed add command | Shows correct format example |
| Multi-word search keyword | Rejected (keyword must be exactly one word) |
* Use consistent date formats for easier reading (e.g., `YYYY-MM-DD`).
* You can list tasks anytime to re-orient yourself.
* Inside organiser: `exit task organiser` or `bye` → returns to main menu.
* From main menu: `bye` → saves (already auto-saved on every change) and exits.
Your tasks are always saved immediately after each change—no manual save needed.
**Q: Do I lose tasks if I close abruptly?**
Changes are flushed on every modifying command. Only an OS-level forced kill during a disk write is risky.
**Q: Can I edit an existing task’s text?**
Not yet. Delete and re-add the task for now.
**Q: Can I use spaces in the find keyword?**
No – `find` accepts exactly one word (no internal spaces). Leading or trailing whitespace is trimmed.

* Encapsulates all task-related operations and persistence hooks for the
* Task Organiser feature. This class is the domain layer that manipulates the
* in-memory list and delegates save/load to {@link chattpg.storage.Storage}.
private final String HELP_MESSAGE = NEWLINE + "Type help to see the full list of commands." + NEWLINE;
* @param tasks   the backing in-memory task list managed by this instance
* @param storage the storage component used to persist tasks
* @param lineSep the UI separator used for consistent console output
public TaskActions(ArrayList<Task> tasks, Storage storage, String lineSep) {
* Loads tasks from storage into the in-memory list on the first call.
* Subsequent calls are idempotent and will not reload (avoiding duplication).
* Always prints the current number of tasks after ensuring the list is loaded.
* Persists the current in-memory task list to storage.
* Prints the full list of tasks with 1-based indices. If the list is empty,
System.out.println("You have no tasks in your list.");
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list, \"X\" means it is marked done: ");
* Parses the user input and appends a new task.
* On success, prints a confirmation and triggers an autosave.

* @throws InvalidCommandException if the input is malformed or unknown

throw new InvalidCommandException("deadline format: deadline <desc> /by <when>" + NEWLINE + lineSep + HELP_MESSAGE + lineSep);
throw new InvalidCommandException("event format: event <desc> /from <start> /to <end>" + NEWLINE + lineSep + HELP_MESSAGE + lineSep);
throw new InvalidCommandException("event parts must not be empty." + NEWLINE + lineSep + HELP_MESSAGE + lineSep);
throw new InvalidCommandException("todo format: todo <desc>" + NEWLINE + lineSep + HELP_MESSAGE + lineSep);
throw new InvalidCommandException("todo requires a description." + NEWLINE + lineSep + HELP_MESSAGE + lineSep);
throw new InvalidCommandException("todo description must not contain /by, /from, or /to." + NEWLINE + "todo format: todo <desc>" + NEWLINE + lineSep + HELP_MESSAGE + lineSep);
throw new InvalidCommandException("Unknown command. Type help for available commands." + NEWLINE + lineSep + HELP_MESSAGE + lineSep);

* Thrown to indicate that a user has entered an invalid or unrecognized command
* in the ChatTPG CLI. Examples include unknown command keywords or malformed
* command arguments (e.g., missing required segments like "/by" or "/from"/"/to").
* Creates a new InvalidCommandException with a human-readable reason.
* The message is typically surfaced directly to the user.
* @param message explanation of why the command is invalid
* Thrown when a user references a task index that is outside the bounds of the
* current task list (e.g., less than 1 or greater than the number of tasks).
* The message usually contains guidance such as the valid range.
* Constructs a new exception indicating the index issue.
* @param message details about the invalid index and expected range
* A {@link Task} with an associated deadline ("/by" value).
* Represents work that must be completed before or by a specific time/date.
* @param description non-blank description of the task
* @param by non-blank deadline indicator (e.g., a date/time string)
* @throws IllegalArgumentException if either parameter is null/blank
* Returns the raw deadline string provided by the user.
* String form used for UI listing, prefixed with [D] and including the deadline.
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {
throw new IllegalArgumentException("/from and /to must differ");

* Entry point and main CLI shell for ChatTPG.

*
  • Render a simple main menu and read user input
* This class intentionally keeps I/O simple (System.in/System.out) and leaves
* task management concerns to the organiser module.
* Constructs a new ChatTPG shell with a shared scanner passed to
* the Task Organiser so both layers read from the same input stream.
* Prints the list of valid top-level commands followed by the prompt.
* Prints the main menu banner and the available options.
* Greets the user and prints a horizontal separator.
System.out.println("What can I do for you?");
* Prints the farewell message before terminating the application.
System.out.println("You shut me down... how sad. Maybe we will meet again...");
* Throws an {@link InvalidCommandException} to signal an unknown command
* to the caller, which is then caught to display a friendly message
* @throws InvalidCommandException always thrown to indicate the command is not recognized
throw new InvalidCommandException("Unknown command. Please try again.");

E | 1 | example of an event | Aug 6th 2pm | Aug 6th 4pm
